data.headline: Infant formula market: a2 Milk rockets but may face regulatory risks in China
data.summary: For those investors looking for exposure to China's booming infant formula market, a2 Milk Company is the hot ticket in town.

data.headline: a2 Milk Company upgrades sales outlook
data.summary: The a2 Milk Company has confirmed that a strong start to June half sales will mean revenue for the full year will be much better than first anticipated.

data.headline: a2 Milk Company appears poised for an earnings upgrade
data.summary: The a2 Milk Company appears set for an an earnings upgrade following a strong start to the second half with tins of baby formula flying off the shelves as it gained market share from rivals.

data.headline: UBS Asset Management's Wood and Gomes on their 'common sense' rules of investing
data.summary: Small caps duo Stephen Wood and Victor Gomes show there is room for folksy wisdom and edgy technology stocks in a portfolio.

data.headline: Gen X, Y go after offshore for tech stocks
data.summary: Millennials traders are going offshore and buying small-name, but big influence tech stocks.

data.headline: Jan Cameron's Black Prince sued Bellamy's for access to documents
data.summary: Federal Court filings obtained by the Financial Review show just how nasty the board battle became.

data.headline: Blackmores CEO Christine Holgate says China rule change not a 'full stop'
data.summary: Blackmores CEO Christine Holgate says she's encouraged by the latest e-commerce ruling in China but it may still change.

data.headline: China backs down on tough new e-commerce laws in boost for Aussie exporters
data.summary: China has backtracked on new cross-border restrictions that had threatened exporters of vitamins, milk powder and cosmetics.

data.headline: Bellamy's debacle not an issue for Blackmores, A2 Milk: analysts
data.summary: The strategic missteps by Bellamy's in selling infant formula to China do not extend to its rivals, analysts said.

data.headline: A2 Milk advertising claims under fire from rival Lion Group
data.summary: Japanese beverage giant Lion Group has accused The a2 Milk Company of deceptive and misleading conduct.

data.headline: Investors keen for a steady return are seeing it happen all over again
data.summary: There's nothing worse than losing money, paying tax and getting caught up on the wrong side of all the volatility. Except having it happen all over again.
